title: Memory requirements for material project dataset
body:
Hi.
I hope you're doing great!

I'm using the training script interfaced with the Material Project dataset.

For a reason I don't understand, the CUDA memory requirements are really high. I'm using the same GPU than precedently, and I have to set batch_size to 4 instead of 256 or 512 in previous cases.

The problem can be reproduced with:
```
python spk_run.py from_json model/args.json
```
with the following `args.json` : 
```
{
    "apikey": null,
    "batch_size": 8,
    "checkpoint_interval": 1,
    "cuda": true,
    "cutoff": 10.0,
    "cutoff_function": "cosine",
    "datapath": "data/mp.db",
    "dataset": "matproj",
    "environment_provider": "torch",
    "features": 128,
    "interactions": 6,
    "keep_n_checkpoints": 3,
    "log_every_n_epochs": 1,
    "logger": "csv",
    "lr": 0.0001,
    "lr_decay": 0.8,
    "lr_min": 1e-06,
    "lr_patience": 25,
    "max_epochs": 5000,
    "max_steps": null,
    "mode": "train",
    "model": "schnet",
    "modelpath": "model/",
    "n_epochs": 1000,
    "num_gaussians": 50,
    "overwrite": false,
    "parallel": false,
    "property": "energy_per_atom",
    "seed": null,
    "split": [
        1000,
        100
    ],
    "split_path": null
}
```

Of course, you might be able to make it work on a GPU with more memory.
Is it expected when studying a periodic system or is it a problem?

Thanks a lot!
